a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Ratio of female to male labor force participation rates, 1960 to
Shown is the female-to-male ratio of labor force participation rates, calculated by dividing the labor force participation rate among
women, by the corresponding rate for men. The labor force participation rate is defined as the proportion of the population ages
Data source: World Bank based on data from the International Labour Organization
